subject: Technology
title: Phone Cameras: From Terrible to Incredible
description: A short lesson to help you apply Phone Cameras: From Terrible to Incredible.

hook.text: The first camera phone took photos at 0.1 megapixels. They looked worse than a postage stamp.

buildup.text: For years, phone cameras were a joke. Blurry, grainy images that real photographers laughed at.

discovery.text: Computational photography changed everything. Software now enhances what tiny lenses can capture.

twist.text: Modern phone cameras outsell standalone cameras by 100 to 1. The camera industry nearly collapsed.

climax.text: Today's phones shoot professional-quality video and take photos that rival expensive DSLR cameras.

punchline.text: Software turned a toy camera into a professional tool.

quiz.question: What made phone cameras dramatically improve?
